intro: Lactuca steelei, commonly known as the steelhead lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, spoon-shaped leaves that are usually green with a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, followed by seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is native to the western United States and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Lactuca steelei is a perennial plant that is adapted to arid conditions and has a slow growth rate.
